intro: Silene stenantha, commonly known as the narrowleaf catchfly, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the Caryophyllaceae family, characterized by its showy, pink to purple flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky habitats and has a low-growing, mat-forming structure. Its leaves are narrow and covered in fine hairs, and it produces small, capsule-like fruits that contain numerous seeds. Silene stenantha is often found in open, disturbed areas and is adapted to arid environments.
